intro: Tetranthera cuspidata, commonly known as the narrowleaf tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Tetranthera cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
